Ethics has also been extended to the hard sciences, such as [[biology]] (as [[bioethics]]) and [[ecology]] (as [[environmental ethics]]). As these fields become more complex and deal with more situations, the application of ethics in those fields can also become more difficult as external forces of theologic politics and morality demand their ethics be applied to sciences. A clear example is where stem cell research has been slowed in the United States by the Anti [[Abortion]] supporters. Here they have limited research to existing stem cell lines and prohibit federal money going to companies who would use embryos that were already slated for destruction from being used.
